intro: Pedicularis palustris subsp. palustris, commonly known as the marsh orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in northern regions. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows up to 60 cm tall, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and a branched stem. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
